clinical_study.brief_title: Lead Mobilization & Bone Turnover in Pregnancy/Lactation

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences (NIEHS)

clinical_study.source: National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences (NIEHS)

brief_summary.textblock: We are examining the role of maternal bone lead turnover during pregnancy and lactation as a potential source of lead exposure for the fetus and the infant (via breast milk). A cohort, ascertained at entry to care, consists of >1000 women to be followed through pregnancy. In the postpartum subjects are recruited for a nested case control study to assess the influence of lactation on maternal bone density, maternal blood lead and breast milk lead.
